posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Right. Valerfor's been messing with my head again (see his "The Last Shinobi" thread in the NwN Tavern sub-forum - though the rest of them could just be in hiding), so I thought I'd have a look at building a Monk/ Rogue/ Shadowdancer. This is very much first thoughts, so please feel free to do as you please with it (within the bounds of decency, of course). I went for unarmed rather than kama because the damage is so much better once you hit Monk 16 - that and the fact that I didn't exactly have feats to burn. And I sacrificed Epic Prowess to get those extra 2 Dex points, so it comes out the same as far as AB goes.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: If you start with 18 DEX, you have 3 points to spend, so you can have 12 STR and 14 INT.  That leaves a feat free for Epic Prowess, so your AB is the same, and you get slightly better STR and more skill points, which is great for a Rogue.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Oh, that's a good idea, thanks Empyre. It will cost 1AC and 1Reflex, but I know I'll feel more comfortable with a STR of 12 (particularly in light of what you said in the Last Shinobi thread about hin only attaining d12 fists). The extra skill points will also come in handy, as - for the first time - I want to make good use of the trapping skills as well as stealth.

I'll save doing the edit until I've worked out some more of the details - and in case anyone else has something to contribute.

Cheers

posts.author: gkorjax
posts.content:
A couple things. One is minor, well perhaps both are minor. Your reported ac is too low, I am sure when you put it in the spread sheet this would be evident, but 10 + 12(dex) +8 (tumble) + 5(monk) +1 (fling) =36

The other is sorta minor, but something you talk about. Or maybe it was in another thread.
Flings aren't going to ever get 1d20 fists...they are small.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Thanks gkorjax - good catch on the AC. I do my builds in pencil and paper and forgot to add in the monk AC bumps. I'll change it in the edit.

Yeah, I didn't know about the non-availability of d20 fists (or age is conspiring against my memory again) for hins until Empyre pointed it out. Might mean some head-scratching on my part as far as race goes. That said, from the video Valerfor provides, it appears that ninja/shinobi foci are stealth and intelligence-gathering, but with the ability to defend oneself, and my intention with this one is to use stealth and traps (going wildly against my natural instincts, but one should keep learning, yes?) more than physical presence, so we'll see...

Thanks for the feedback!

Oh bugger, I'm now thinking about an elf - but that puts me in Mick's Kama-Shinobi headlights...Except this isn't meant to be a dual-wielder or a kama-user - and I would get the d20 fists, and elves are traditionally a stealthy bunch. posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote: Monk 26/ Rogue 13/ SD 1
Halfling
Does it look reasonable as a principle?
It does look reasonable.
As for Epic Prowess, you can do what Empyre suggests, or you can free up a general feat by taking Epic dodge on a rogue bonus feat rather than Crippling strike and gain +1 AB.
Or you can make a Monk 20/ Rogue 19/ SD1 build and start with Dex 18 like Empyre suggests, but take both EP and AS on general feats and have 4 rogue bonus feats for Defensive roll, Epic dodge, Crippling strike and another free feat for Slippery mind, Skill mastery or an Epic skill focus.

20 Monk compared to 26 cost 20% speed bonus, 6 SR and 1 AC
19 Rogue compared to 13 gains 3d6 SA damage, 24 skill points and an Epic bonus feat.
If you keep the same pre epic split, the saves will not change.
